CatDescriptText: Ruth Richards, 90 Melrose Avenue, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 2, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you believe Negroes, who get public assistance, do more cheating than whites?" answer reads: "Actually, I don't know that much about it and therefore really do not know."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of two girls, and Ruth Richards wearing striped shirt, light colored coat, and holding light colored handbag, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
